Text: Cc your Questions Both Plants What are the short term NOx and CO emissions during startups and are there limitations during startups See answers provided by Mitch and Pat In addition I offer the following Caledonia There is no specific exemption in the permit for startup and shutdown We tried to request one when we modified the permit for peak firing in May The state told us however that there is no need to provide a specific exemption in the permit and that we can rely on the exemption provided in the general rules under APCS Section Brownsville Again there is no specific exemption for startup and shutdown We are relying on the exemption provided in the general rules under regulation which calls for implementation of good management practice to minimize emissions during startup and shutdown Are industrial stormwater permits required at either site No There is no wastewater discharge at either site Caledonia In Caledonia what is the custom fuel sampling schedule We are implementing the recommended EPA protocol for natural gas sampling which calls for twice per month the first six months then once per quarter the first six quarters then semiannually thereafter However since we are also required under Part to analyze for the natural gas heat content on a monthly basis I have asked the plant managers to analyze for the sulfur content monthly Brownsville What is the agencys response to the Enron letter regarding the nd stormwater NOV We have not received any written correspondence from the agency following the second NOV However the site was inspected after completion of the corrective measures around June and the state inspector was satisfied with the progress made to bring the site into compliance with the stormwater construction permit Has there been any further action by the agency since the st stormwater NOV was never responded to I am not aware of any action One memo stated that the stormwater is channeled to a wetland Was that during construction only or is it ongoing I am not aware of anything existing I believe that this is during construction Mitchell any thoughts on that Were there any further problems with the B T Readymix concrete dumping issue Mitchell Please respond to this question

Re Cc only one quarterly report required for Brownsville This is the EPA electronic data report EDR which we generate from the CEMS system and submit electronically to the EPA Mitchell Since you are generating the rd quarter reports to the EPA today would you please copy Ben on the submittal Thanks Gus Benjamin CT PM To Gus nron cc Don CT Subject Gus Do you happen to have or know where the CEMS Quarterly Report for Brownsville may be Thanks Ben

Re Wheatland Information Needed Cc I am not aware of any IURC reporting requirements we are having to comply with Ross Chris any comments Gus Benjamin CT PM To Gus NRON cc Don CT Subject Re Wheatland Information Needed Gus Are you able to assistance me in answering I have already received Daves comments Thanks Ben

Re Wheatland Information Needed Cc I looked into the EPCRA reporting requirements for Sulfuric acid and lead in batteries This is a one time report to the States emergency planning committee the local emergency response department and the local fire department declaring the presence of sulfuric acid and lead in quantities greater than lb and lb respectively These notifications are being mailed out today I have not had a chance to do a detailed calculation of the amounts I will do an analysis over the next few months to determine if we are required to also annually report by March st every year Dave will answer the first two issues below Thanks Gus Don CT AM To Dave CT Gus nron Benjamin CT cc Subject Wheatland Information Needed Any way that I can get responses to these by this afternoon Ben will followup with you all shortly Thanks for the help Don Forwarded by Don MillerHOUECT on AM Wright Amy H Amy PLINCcom on AM To cc Flanagan Susan Susan PLINCcom Miller Scott Scott PLINCcom Subject Wheatland Information Needed Don based on our conference call last week and the fax sent to me I am still in need of the following The air permit to construct application as submitted to IDEM and any correspondence related to the application I do not need the actual permit as issued by IDEM Petition for Alternate testing The cover page was faxed Dave Kellermeyer was to Fed Ex the remainder If this has been done let me know I will have to track it down Determination of EPCRA reporting requirements for lead acid batteries Additionally we discussed yesterday a request for any analytical data associated with the Lake Acquisition property particularly sediment samples from the lake bottom Thanks for your help Amy H Wright Manager Environmental Management DPL Inc Washington Village Drive Centerville Ohio Phone Fax CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE This electronic mail message and any attachments to this electronic mail message contain confidential information belonging to the originator and may be attorney client privileged or constitute inside information It is intended only for the use of the individuals listed as the recipients If you are not one of the intended recipients you are hereby notified that any disclosure copying distribution or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of the electronically mailed information is strictly prohibited If you have received this electronic mail message in error please forward the electronic mail message to and then remove all traces of the electronic mail message from your system The Dayton Power Light Company
Re Cc I drafted an answer to the SPCC question Gus

Re DPL Meeting On Thursday Cc I will not be able to attend the meeting tomorrow at PM because of a Drs appointment Between Dave and Chris and all the written answers we provided you should be covered on environmental I will be glad to help out with any additional questions they may have Ben The answer to the question you left me on voice mail is no I have not yet received a written response from EPA approving the CEMS certification extension deadline until January I was verbally told that our request was approved in a policy review committee held on October DPL can verify this approval by calling my EPA Clean Air Markets Division Contact Louis Nichols at Thanks Gus
went through all Alleghenys questions and provided answers as best as I can Additional input is needed from other key players Gus
Cc Attached are my responses to DPLs environmental questions on Wheatland Additional input from Dave Kellermeyer and Chris Norris will be provided later today Thanks Gus

Re Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Cc attached file contains the answers to the questions listed in your email for Lincoln Gus Benjamin CT AM To Gus nron cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Forgot to include these questions Thanks for the call this morning your help is very much appreciated Ben Forwarded by Benjamin RogersHOUECT on AM Don Miller AM To Benjamin CT cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Forwarded by Don MillerHOUECT on AM on PM To cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Don As a result of our review of the information and documents on Lincoln we are requesting additional documents which are not in the data room Relating to the plants PSD The Mostardi Platt emissions test protocol for the May emissions test A report to Illlinois EPA containing the emission test data Continuous Emission Monitoring CEM Data all data developed since startup Any reports to IEPA required under the permit pertaining to exceedances or startup breakdown malfunction we have internal memos indicating that there was a breakdown at on July Also we dont have any permits for wastewater discharge We have been told that there is no wastewater discharged except sewageoffice wastewater which is going to a septic field But we have no verification of this at this point Thank you for your attention to these items Mario H Hurtado Duke Energy North America

Re Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Cc The attache file contains the answers to the questions included in your email for Lincoln Gus Benjamin CT AM To Gus nron cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Forgot to include these questions Thanks for the call this morning your help is very much appreciated Ben Forwarded by Benjamin RogersHOUECT on AM Don Miller AM To Benjamin CT cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Forwarded by Don MillerHOUECT on AM on PM To cc Subject Questions regarding PSD permit for Lincoln Don As a result of our review of the information and documents on Lincoln we are requesting additional documents which are not in the data room Relating to the plants PSD The Mostardi Platt emissions test protocol for the May emissions test A report to Illlinois EPA containing the emission test data Continuous Emission Monitoring CEM Data all data developed since startup Any reports to IEPA required under the permit pertaining to exceedances or startup breakdown malfunction we have internal memos indicating that there was a breakdown at on July Also we dont have any permits for wastewater discharge We have been told that there is no wastewater discharged except sewageoffice wastewater which is going to a septic field But we have no verification of this at this point Thank you for your attention to these items Mario H Hurtado Duke Energy North America

Re Additional requests for Caledonia and Brownsville sites Cc the questions below Caledonia Copy of SO allowances for and Are these allowances transferrable Gus will provide by the end of the day SPCC plan Gus will provide a copy Emergency Response Plan Pat will provide a copy CEMS QAAC Plan Pat will provide a copy CEMS Certification Test Report Should be on DealBench Copy of monthly log of fuel heat content fuel usage total heat input per air permit for and There is no requirement for a monthly log but we can provide the information for the calculated day rolling heat input Pat please email Ben a copy of the last semiannual report Copy of annual emissions reports or similar Gus will provide by the end of the day Any water supply agreements with local utilities Pat will answer this question Copies of CEMS daily reports with all NOx fuel and MW values for each turbine for one operating day for the months of June July August September and one winter or shoulder month Pat will provide info Brownsville Copy of SO allowances for and Are these allowances transferrable Gus Will provide by the end of the day Copies of CEMS daily reports with all NOx fuel and MW values for each turbine for one operating day for the months of June July August September and one winter or shoulder month Mitchell will provide info Copies of well reports logs and drawdown reports for the water wells Mitchell will provide info Copies of any permits certifications approvals necessary to install and operate the wells Dave Mitchell Provide the proposed plan to further address the nois issue at the site Ross Mitch Mitchell Explain permit efforts if any for condensate at plant No permitting efforts at this time

Re Cc I took out the first sentence from your answer to question The CFR you wanted to refer to is part and not part In any case I really do not think that the part NSPS Subpart GG limit of ppm applies during startup and shut down I believe that we are covered by the provisions of part Subchapter A Section d which calls only for good air pollution control practice to minimize emissions during startup and shutdown No short term emission limits apply during startup and shutdown The only issue with startup and shut down emissions is that they get counted toward your total emissions for the year and you certainly covered this issue in your last paragraph to question The revised file is attached Gus

Re BrownsilleRequest for additional data Cc Brownsville SPCC plan The plan is currently in draft form It will be finalized and signed by the end of the week Emergency Response Plan We are not required to have one by law However I believe we do have one for the site Mitchell please have your assistant make a copy and send it to Ben CEMS QAQC Available at the plant Mitchell will provide a copy CEMS certification report Should already be on DealBench Monthly log of emissions as required by condition of the permit Available at the plant Mitchell has already given Duke a copy for the month of October when they were onsite yesterday Annual Emissions Report condition We submitted two semiannual reports for the site so far one on January and another on July Mitchell will provide copy of the July report and the January report if available The January report covers emissions for the third and fourth quarters of This is really the annual report for because we did not operate in the first and second quarters of Duke already saw the July report covering January through June Gus Benjamin CT PM To Gus nron Dave CT cc Don CT Subject BrownsilleRequest for additional data Guys Here are some items that Duke is looking for Please let me know if you have any idea where they can be found Some may be in DealBench that I am currently going through to find Thanks agian for your assistance Ben Forwarded by Benjamin RogersHOUECT on PM Don Miller PM To Benjamin CT cc Subject BrownsilleRequest for additional data Forwarded by Don MillerHOUECT on PM on PM To cc Subject BrownsilleRequest for additional data Don I am an environmental manager for DENA that is managing the environmental issues for the Brownsville and Caledonia projects I request copies of the following information for the Brownsville site SPCC plan Emergency Response Plan CEMS QAAC Plan CEMS Certification Test Report Copy of monthly log of fuel heat content fuel usage total heat input per of the air permit F Copy of annual emissions reports as required under of the air permit

Re DPL Meeting On Thursday Cc I will not be able to attend the meeting tomorrow at PM because of a Drs appointment Between Dave and Chris and all the written answers we provided you should be covered on environmental I will be glad to help out with any additional questions they may have Ben The answer to the question you left me on voice mail is no I have not yet received a written response from EPA approving the CEMS certification extension deadline until January I was verbally told that our request was approved in a policy review committee held on October DPL can verify this approval by calling my EPA Clean Air Markets Division Contact Louis Nichols at Thanks Gus

Re Cc only one quarterly report required for Brownsville This is the EPA electronic data report EDR which we generate from the CEMS system and submit electronically to the EPA Mitchell Since you are generating the rd quarter reports to the EPA today would you please copy Ben on the submittal Thanks Gus Benjamin CT PM To Gus nron cc Don CT Subject Gus Do you happen to have or know where the CEMS Quarterly Report for Brownsville may be Thanks Ben

Re New Mexico Generation Plans EES Cc Christi Attached is the final public notice for the proposed Gallup generation plant in New Mexico This notice was published in a local newspaper yesterday May th It provides a good description of the project its location and estimated emissions The actual permit application will be filed with the agency today The following are few things to keep in mind as we respond to inquires from concerned citizens The plant will consist of a number of reciprocating engines each producing less than MW The plant will be a MW plant fired with either natural gas or diesel oil The plant will be a minor source of air pollution The plant will not be subject to the EPA Prevention of Significant Deterioration PSD Annual emissions of any criteria pollutant will not exceed tons per year The plant will be a minor source of Hazardous air pollutants The plant will not be subject to Federal Clean Air Act Section g for hazardous air pollutants There are no New Source Performance standards applicable to the site The plant will be exempt from the EPA acid rain program None of the engines serves a generator MW By way of dispersion modeling we are demonstrating that the plant will not significantly impact the state or national ambient air quality standards The plant will operate as a peaker plant with limited hours of operation per year Please forward any environmental questions to me Commercial and legal questions should go to Marc Pana and Andrew Ralston Thanks for your help Gus
